title: Julie Andrews reveals Mary Poppins flying scene almost went very wrong
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Julie Andrews has revealed that one of her flying scenes from Mary Poppins almost went very wrong – and she’s surprised that she survived the whole thing.

We all grew up watching the beloved Disney classic from 1964, in which the titular character, as played by Julie, was known to ‘fly’ away in the sky while holding an umbrella, so it’s hard to believe that things could have turned out a lot more tragic.

Speaking on Live With Kelly And Ryan, the actress spoke about how she performed her own stunts for the movie, with the production team leaving the ‘really hard stuff’ until the final day of shooting.

‘I wore a flying harness, which was pretty excruciating because it was two steel plates that kind of dug into one’s hips,’ she explained.

‘They saved all the really difficult, really hard stuff until the very last day of shooting, in case of an accident, I guess – in which case most of the film was already in the can.’

And things seemed to be going well at first – that was until Julie was suspended high above the sound stage.

Mary Poppins is one of Julie’s best known movie roles (Picture: Rex/AP/Disney)

‘I suddenly got very nervous and thought I felt the rope give a little bit, or the wire, so I called down from way up in the ceiling and said, “Could you let me down a little… because I think the wire gave,” at which point I plummeted to the stage,’ she said.

However, she later recalled the pulley system used to put her in the air helped to save her in the end.

‘I was on counter weights and all of that, so I hit [the stage] pretty heavily. It was kind of funny, and I’m glad I was weighted, let me say.’

And it wasn’t all that bad in the end – as Julie later won an Oscar for best actress for her portrayal of the much-loved nanny in the film.
